newsitem.title: USA: Delta Air, Varig end code-sharing pact.
newsitem.headline: Delta Air, Varig end code-sharing pact.

text.p: Delta Air Lines Inc said Varig Brazilian Airlines ended a code-share agreement that began in 1994.
Delta said the exact date for the end of the Varig code-share is now under discussion, but the service is expected to end late this summer.
The deal allowed it to sell seats on Varig flights from Atlanta, Los Angeles, New York, and Miami to Brazil.
Delta had previously filed with the U.S. Department of Transportation for authority to operate its own flights to Brazil over routes which become available to U.S. carriers on April 1.
"The new Brazilian authority we are seeking will be the cornerstone of Delta's South America service," said Vince Caminiti, Delta's senior vice president - sales and international.

Delta has proposed a daily round-trip flight operating over a route from Cincinnati to Atlanta to Sao Paulo. A second daily Delta round-trip flight would operate from New York to Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro. Delta's Cincinnati-Atlanta flight would connect in Sao Paulo to Delta's Rio de Janeiro flight, Delta said.
